pullRequest.title: Fix bug in resolution of VT arrays and fields
pullRequest.bodyText:
Fix bug in resolution of VT arrays and fields
When creating an array the elements of the array are set to the default
value. For arrays of regular identity types this is NULL. For arrays of
valueTypes this is the defaultValue of the valueType. As a result, if
the element type of the array is a valueType, the element type must be
fully initialized before the array can be created. This PR addresses
this problem.
Also, in the resolve field code, it is incorrectly fetching the
flattened field cache from the class where the fieldref is stored
instead of the class that defined the field. We havent noticed this
because the existing tests only fetches fields using getter methods.
Signed-off-by: Tobi Ajila atobia@ca.ibm.com

nodes.bodyText: You probably want to pass in J9_RESOLVE_FLAG_INIT_CLASS as well here to avoid going around the loop again.

beforeCommit.message:

afterCommit.message:
Fix bug in resolution of VT arrays and fields

When creating an array the elements of the array are set to the default
value. For arrays of regular identity types this is NULL. For arrays of
valueTypes this is the defaultValue of the valueType. As a result, if
the element type of the array is a valueType, the element type must be
fully initialized before the array can be created. This PR addresses
this problem.

Also, in the resolveSupport code, it is incorrectly fetching the
flattened field cache from the class where the fieldref is stored
instead of the class that defined the field. We havent noticed this
because the existing tests only fetches fields using getter methods.

Signed-off-by: Tobi Ajila <atobia@ca.ibm.com>

nodes.bodyText:
If this fails, you should probably return NULL (presumably the caller already has to handle any pending exceptions). Check pending exception here and set result to NULL (and re-NULL the arrayClass field).
@DanHeidinga Any issue you can see here? We won't allow another attempt to initialize the VT class, so the failure should be persistent.

nodes.bodyText:
This is problematic - there's a timing hole where the array class would be visible to another thread before being NULLed.
Probably the answer is to initialize the VT class before starting to create the array class.

commit.message:
Fix bug in resolution of VT arrays and fields

When creating an array the elements of the array are set to the default
value. For arrays of regular identity types this is NULL. For arrays of
valueTypes this is the defaultValue of the valueType. As a result, if

fully initialized before the array can be created. This PR addresses
this problem.

Also, in the resolve field code, it is incorrectly fetching the
flattened field cache from the class where the fieldref is stored
instead of the class that defined the field. We havent noticed this
because the existing tests only fetches fields using getter methods.

Signed-off-by: Tobi Ajila <atobia@ca.ibm.com>
